title: What did Lottie Lion say to fellow Apprentice candidate Lubna Farhan?
text:
Lottie Lion has been at the centre of a row involving fellow Apprentice contestant Lubna Farhan (Picture: BBC)

The Apprentice is no stranger to a spot of controversy, and this year it’s come in the shape of a row involving contestants Lottie Lion and Lubna Farhan.

Lottie, 19, has been at the centre of the storm over comments she is said to have made in a group Whatsapp chat towards Lubna, who was fired on last Wednesday night’s show.

The row resulted in Lottie coming under investigation from The Apprentice team – but just what is she reported to have said?

Here’s what you need to know…

What did Lottie Lion say to fellow Apprentice candidate Lubna Farhan?

In the chat, according to The Sun, Lottie claimed she’d never spoken to a black person before, which Lubna debunked by sending a picture of the candidate with a friend alongside the dig: ‘I thought she’d never met a “black person”.’

‘Seriously f*** off Lubna before I f**king knock you out at our press training,’ Lottie wrote back.

Lottie is one of 16 candidates taking part on the show this year (Picture: PA)

‘Lubna I f***ing swear if you disrespect me again I will f*** you up, you embarrassing failure of a businesswoman.’

‘Shut up Ghandi (sic) that doesn’t even make sense.’

What has Lottie said about the row?

The librarian has since released a statement via PA in relation to the clash, saying: ‘It is not true that I would ever be racist.

‘My use of the word Gandhi was misinterpreted, it was as candidates in the group chat had been quoting Gandhi previously.

‘The comments were taken out of context, and I ask the public not to make judgment without knowing the full context. At the moment, I would like my focus to be on the show, and I’m not interested in negative media attention.’

What has Lubna said about the row?

Lubna was fired in last week’s show (Picture: BBC)

Lubna addressed the incident after getting her marching orders from the boardroom last week.

‘All I can say is I wish her well, she has a lot to learn in terms of how to treat people,’ the 33-year-old said of the comments. ‘But she is quite young and I’m sure that within this process she has learnt a lot and will take something from it.’

What has the BBC said?

A BBC spokesperson told Metro.co.uk: ‘While this happened on a private messenger service once filming had concluded, the BBC nevertheless still expects the candidates to behave appropriately.

‘The production company have looked into the issue and reported back, Lottie has been informed that her comments were wholly unacceptable and is in no doubt about our view on this.’

However it’s been reported that other candidates are set to raise fresh complaints to the BBC over the incident – while fellow candidate Souleyman Bah has also spoken out about what happened.

Speaking on podcast The Wake Up Call alongside 2018 winner Sian Gabbidon, Souleyman said: ‘I think there were comments that, you know, yeah… I won’t get into the details of it, but I think it was definitely what it was.

‘I will counter that by saying it was ignorance, really. It’s definitely ignorant racism. I think there’s blatant racism and then there’s ignorant racism.’

When is The Apprentice on?

The series continues on BBC One on Wednesday night at 9pm.

description: The Apprentice's Lottie Lion has found herself at the centre of a row over comments made to last week's fired candidate Lubna Farhan.
